course_description: Readings and discussion regarding language study past and present, including the study of language and its relation to thought. course_description: Basic signing vocabulary and grammar, including a brief history of sign language. Focus on basic finger spelling, ASL terminology, expressive and receptive vocabulary, sentence structure, and conversational signs. Examination of issues in deaf culture. Introduces the Direct Experience method.

course_description: Application of descriptive and articulatory phonetics to speech sound perception and production in first and subsequent languages. This includes developing a foundational knowledge of how speech perception and production develop, and distinctions between speech disorders and foreign accents. It also includes the development of phonetic transcription skills to the analysis of speech sounds produced by a variety of speakers, including subsequent language speakers.
prerequisites: Exclusions: Completion of this course will replace previous assigned grade and credit obtained in LING 3P51.

course_name: Top in Subsequent Lang Acquisition & Learning
course_description: Critical examination of social and cultural issues relevant to second language acquisition and learning worldwide. Topics may include languages and globalization, linguistic imperialism, second language learning and identity, heritage language maintenance, languages and conflict, second language policy and planning, second language teaching in instructional contexts.
prerequisites: Notes: Open to Certificate students. Click on course name to see restriction for list. Open to majors with approval to Year IV (honours). this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_description: Principles and procedures of clinical evaluation in speech-language pathology from initial referral to report writing. Topics include clinical interviewing, psychometric properties of norm-referenced tests, instrumental and other forms of measurement and ethical and cultural considerations for assessing speech, voice and language disorders across the lifespan.
prerequisites: Notes: Open to Certificate students. Click on course name to see restriction for list. Open to majors with approval to Year IV (honours). this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_description: Case-based video analysis of selected disorders of speech, language, hearing and/or swallowing. Covers assessment and intervention.

course_description: Acoustics and psychoacoustics of hearing. Review of anatomy and physiology of the ear. Electroacoustic characteristics and maintenance of a variety of assistive listening devices. Principles and methods of aural rehabilitation.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): LING 3P97.

course_description: Acoustics and psychoacoustics of hearing. Review of anatomy and physiology of the ear. Electroacoustic characteristics and maintenance of a variety of assistive listening devices. Principles and methods of aural rehabilitation.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): LING 3P97.

course_description: Theories and practices of language testing in research and teaching. Focus on critical analysis and evaluation of psychometric and pragmatic tests through item analysis and/or latent trait measurement.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): LING 1P94 and 1P95 (1F94) or permission of the Chair.

course_description: Linguistic and constraints on mixing and code-switching, the organization of the bilingual lexicon, language processing in bilinguals, language attrition.
prerequisites: Notes: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_description: Classroom observation, and planning, managing and delivering second language instruction. Discussions on current conceptual knowledge (theoretical) and perceptual knowledge (practical) highlighted with reference to the subsequent language teaching and learning context.
prerequisites: Notes: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_description: Supervised class observation of lesson planning, teaching and evaluation. Issues related to second language teaching in diverse contexts.
prerequisites: Notes: Consult the Chair regarding permission to register . not approved by TESL Ontario as meeting the supervised teaching requirements for TESL Ontario Certification as an adult ESL instructor. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

course_name: Teach Listen & Speak in a Subsequent Language
course_description: Theories of and issues in the development of oral language processing in a subsequent language. Canadian Language Benchmarks. Implications and applications for selected teaching and learning situations.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): LING 1P94 and 1P95 (1F94) or permission of the Chair.

course_name: Teach Read & Writing in a Subsequent Language
course_description: Selected theories and models underlying reading and writing ability. Their relationship to the concept of grammar and influence on inter-language development. Canadian Language Benchmarks. Implications and applications for selected teaching and learning situations.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Prerequisite(s): LING 1P94 and 1P95 (1F94) or permission of the Chair.
